Story: My phone buzzed just as I was about to log my next call. It was Jamie, my best friend, her voice shaky and urgent. “My car broke down on the highway. Can you come get me? Please, I’m scared.” I glanced at the clock—my break was in ten minutes, but the call volume was low tonight, and the supervisors had said we could be flexible. Still, I was supposed to stick to my scheduled hours, and leaving early without notice could get me in trouble. My headset itched against my ear as I listened to Jamie’s breathing, picturing her stranded in the dark. I knew she’d do the same for me, no questions asked. But I also knew my job was on the line, and I’d already been warned about not following protocol. My heart pounded as I weighed the responsibility of being a reliable friend against the expectations of my job. I stared at the blinking cursor on my screen, torn between duty and loyalty, feeling the pressure of both roles closing in on me.
